name: Taj Residency

reviews.title: Clean and affordable
reviews.text: I was staying at the hotel for one night. The staff was very friendly and liked to help. The hotel was clean, even for European standards. The food was good.
I got affordable offer (51 EUR) which made this hotel a good value for me. The food is a bit pricey, though.
reviews.title: Mythological Architecture

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not much to do, when you're not out watching Ellora caves and other sightseeings, and almost no non-Indian guest.
reviews.title: Angagement

reviews.text: Since I took out an expensive cannon EOS mark 3D SLR I have been kept looking at chnaces to come down to Maharashtra India, and my friends were decided to march in march.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: Its been a great visit and the hotel we stayed was a great Architecture I have ever seen. I asked the manager if its been recrafted from any old building or its make to llok like it - She said yes its one of the Mythological Architecture crafted for giving westners a quite a bit taste of Modern Civilization existed before 100-400 year. My EOS 3d was very lucky and effective to capture the famous paintings and wallimages.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Taj Aurangabad doesn't share the over the top luxury of some of the other Taj properties in bigger name destinations, but it does share most of the comforts. The pool is lovely, and the property is peaceful.
reviews.title: A relaxing base to see Ajanta and Ellora
good stay option
reviews.text: The restaurant, simply, is bad. It's not worth the price, and I would suggest going elsewhere for meals other than the included breakfast.

We had some trouble with members of a conference going on at the hotel. Most rooms face the pool, and when my girlfriend tried to go swimming, many of the convention participants came out onto their balconies and started staring at her and taking photos. I imagine this isn't usually the case, but it was troubling to us. To their credit, the staff did everything they could to help.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: we'd taken a 3 day trip - good hotel, would rank it 4 star. nice food and service, like any other Taj property
reviews.title: Nice and easy stay

reviews.text: Staff are friendly and like to chat.
reviews.title: Must Visit Property

reviews.text: We stayed at the Taj Residency, Aurangabad last October. The hotel looks majestic and the pool is great.
reviews.title: loved the pool

likes.liked: — The view from the room was great

reviews.text: The room was quite good and they have a sumptuous buffet spread. We really enjoyed our stay and would love to go back.
reviews.title: Comfortable Gateway to Ajanta Caves

reviews.text: The hotel is spread over a large area and our roomoverlooked the pool and garden. It was a delight to be at the Taj.
reviews.title: Loved the property

reviews.text: Taj is a good value for money. We booked by using the Taj reservations and the cost was around INR 4500 for a standard for couples. We had few of our friends visiting from Canada and Belgium.
reviews.title: Best hotel option available in Aurangabad

reviews.text: It was nice stay, it is a nice property but food is not okay.
reviews.title: Average stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a big disappointment and not up to the expected standard for a Taj hotel. It is probably the best hotel available in Aurangabad and the Ellora and Ajanta caves are spectacular and not to be missed. Taj needs to do something to improve things at this hotel. The hotel is staffed primarily be trainees who are furnished by Taj's hotel academy located right next door. We found that no staff members were able to answer simple questions without consulting with senior staff. On one occasion, when I first called "Operator" and then the front desk to ask a question, no one answered after 20 rings at each extension. The service in the restaurant was sub-standard and the "barbecue" was overpriced for what it was. In fact, in addition to the fixed price barbecue cost, we were charged 450 rupees for a small Perrier. I questioned this charge and was told that it was "correct." I also mentioned this charge to a manager at the time of checkout and was kept waiting more than 10 minutes while he disappeared to check on it and never returned. Our room had been renovated but was still not much better than motel standard. The hotel has a nice pool and the grounds are attractive but a major upgrade is needed. On the positive side, although we had to check out at 8 AM in order to leave for the Ajanta caves, the hotel provided us with a room at no additional charge when we returned in order to shower and change before we left for the airport in the evening.
reviews.title: Trainee Hotel
